Overview Using the installer

SVN Access Manager overview

SVN Access Manager is a powerful tool for managing access to subversion repositories. The tool provides user and group management and access rights (read /write) to dedicated paths in a repository as well.

Getting started

To use SVN Access Manager you need at least:

  • a working subversion installation
  • a MySQL Database, version 4 or higher
  • an Apache webserver, version 2.0 or higher with DAV, mod_authz and SVN support
  • PHP version 4 or higher

Get the software

First download the source archive from sourceforge.net.

Install

Installation is divided up in several parts. Just follow the instructions below.

Install the software

Go to a directory where the software can be accessed by your Apache webserver. Unpack the archive. That's it. Proceed with setting up the Apache webserver.

Setup your Apache webserver

Your webserver must know about the SVN Access Manager if it is not installed in the DocumentRoot of your webserver. In the latter case you can include a line similar to this in your webserver configuration:

Alias /svnaccessmanager /[path_to_svn_access_manager]/svn_access_manager

After adding this don't forget to reload your webserver to make sure the configuration changes are active.

Setup a MySQL database and a database user

You need a database for SVN Access manager and an user with full access to this database. To create the database do the following as root user of your MySQL database:

CREATE DATABASE svnadmin;

To create a user having access to this database do the following as root user of your MySQL database:

CREATE USER 'svnadmin'@ 'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY '*******';

GRANT USAGE ON * . * TO 'svnadmin'@ 'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY '*******' 
            WITH MAX_QUERIES_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_CONNECTIONS_PER_HOUR 0 
                 MAX_UPDATES_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_USER_CONNECTIONS 0 ;

GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON `svnadmin` . * TO 'svnadmin'@ 'localhost';

After finishing the database work continue with installing SVN Access Manager.

Using the installer

Important notice:
Please remove the installer script after finishing the installation. It is a security risk to have the installer on a global accessable site!

The installer ist started by entering the following URL into your web browser presuming that you have the alias mentioned above. Otherwise please fill in the values fitting your installation:

http(s)://[your_domain]/svnaccessmanager/install/install.php

It is recommended to use https to access the installer because of the fact that passwords are sent to the webserver!
